title: Crush Real Estate Agent Tasks with the Right Planner
excerpt: Key Points Real estate agent tasks build up fast without the right planning system A strong real estate agent planner keeps follow-ups, listings, and priorities…
content:
Key Points

  • Real estate agent tasks build up fast without the right planning system
  • A strong real estate agent planner keeps follow-ups, listings, and priorities on track
  • Real estate agent time management is critical to closing more deals
  • Use planners that sync with your CRM, email, and calendar
  • A good real estate agent daily planner helps block time and track goals
  • Teams need shared agent task management tools to avoid dropped balls
  • Digital planners offer flexibility, reminders, and automation
  • Paper planners help agents who think better with pen and paper
  • The best planner for real estate agents fits your workflow – not just your desk

Real estate agent tasks don’t politely line up – they stampede. Between showings, lead follow-ups, your real estate agent marketing plan, and that last-minute “just checking in” text from a client who ghosted you three weeks ago, it’s a miracle anything gets done. Heads up: “just winging it” is not a business strategy – it’s a fast track to burnout, missed deals, and crying in your car between appointments.

The best real estate planners (digital or paper) don’t just help you stay organized – they help you stay in business. Whether you’re a sticky-note junkie or living in your Google Calendar, this blog is your no-fluff guide to picking a planner that actually supports your real estate agent plan – not sabotages it.

Here’s your handy dandy index:

Section 1: Why Real Estate Agents Need a Planner

Section 2: Real Estate Agent Task & Goal Management

Section 3: Planning as a Team Sport

Section 4: Digital vs. Paper Planners for Agents

Section 5: Comparing Real Estate Planners

Trello for Real Estate Agents
2025 Real Estate Agent Planner Pro
PhoneLife Daily Realtor Digital Planner
Vertical Week + Month Planner
Gemma Weekly Weekly/Monthly Planning Calendar
ClickUp for Real Estate Agents
Monday.com for Real Estate Teams
Basecamp for Real Estate Collaboration
Smartsheet for Real Estate Project Tracking
Flowlu for Comprehensive Real Estate Management
Asana for Real Estate Agents
The Planner Is the Playbook: Stop Winging It, Start Winning It
Frequently Asked Questions

Section 1: Why Real Estate Agents Need a Planner

Your Real Estate Agent Plan Starts Here

Real estate agent tasks don’t trickle in – they flood your day like buyers at a price drop. Showings, offers, lead follow-ups, and that never-ending real estate agent marketing plan? Yeah, that’s all before noon. Without a real estate agent planner – ideally a modern real estate agent daily planner 2025 style system – you’re one missed appointment away from chaos.

Top producers aren’t winging it. Ask them what real estate agents do and you won’t hear “panic-scroll through texts to remember who they forgot.” A solid real estate agent plan doesn’t just keep your calendar clean – it keeps your sanity intact. The best planner for real estate agents doesn’t live in a junk drawer. It’s built around real estate agent best practices, designed to keep up with your listings, leads, and all the fire drills in between.

Why Time Management Is Where Agents Crash and Burn

This job doesn’t come with a manual – but it should come with a planner. The top mistake? Thinking you’ll “just remember.” And then you don’t. One missed call, one forgotten contract, and poof – there goes the deal. Real estate agent time management isn’t optional; it’s the entire ball game.

Wondering what software do real estate agents use to stay on track? The smart ones use a synced, automated, task-eating real estate agent planner that talks to their CRM, email, and calendar. Because consistency closes, and Post-it notes do not.

Section 2: Real Estate Agent Task & Goal Management

Mastering the Real Estate Agent To-Do List

Let’s not pretend: real estate agent daily tasks aren’t complicated, they’re just relentless. You’re juggling prospecting, nurturing, contracts, your real estate agent marketing plan, and maybe eating a snack if there’s time. The trick isn’t doing more – it’s doing what matters.

A proper agent task management setup helps you filter the noise. Forget “productivity hacks.” You need a real estate agent daily planner that helps you stick to your agent to-do list and block time for actual money-making activities. Preferably one that doesn’t get buried under a pile of listing flyers.

Track Progress Like You Mean It

A smart real estate agent planner 2025 doesn’t just collect tasks – it shows you progress. Whether it’s 20 calls, 3 meetings, or 2 deals this month, you should know exactly where you stand. The right system turns tasks into wins and inertia into closings.

Time Block Like Your Commission Depends on It (Because It Does)

Forgetting a task isn’t a whoops – it’s a lost paycheck. Great real estate agent time management means using reminders, recurring tasks, and blocking time for things like lead gen and offer follow-ups. Set it. Stick to it. Stop trying to run your business off memory alone.

Section 3: Planning as a Team Sport

Your Agent Planner Isn’t Just for You

Tasks of a real estate agent expand in direct proportion to the number of people on your team. Suddenly it’s not just your chaos – it’s a shared group project with commission checks on the line. That’s why your real estate agent planner needs to double as a team command center.

Shared visibility = fewer “Wait, who was doing that?” moments. A synced agent calendar or agent task management tool keeps everyone on the same page, so no one’s dropping the ball – or the open house signs.

Section 4: Digital vs. Paper Planners for Agents

Digital Planners: Built for Speed and Sanity

Ask any efficient agent what real estate agent tools are worth it, and they’ll point to their digital planner. The best real estate planners in 2025 do more than schedule – they sync your calendar, leads, tasks, and even your follow-ups. You want real real estate agent time management? Start blocking time for calls, showings, and those “quick” emails that hijack your day.

Most digital planners sync with your CRM, email, and tools like Calendly or Google Calendar. It’s like putting your real estate agent tasks on cruise control – minus the crashes.

Paper Planners: For Agents Who Think in Ink

If you’re the type who remembers things better after physically writing them, a paper real estate agent planner still does the job. It’s tactile, distraction-free, and lets you focus without falling into the TikTok time warp. Some agents even double-dip – digital for schedule, paper for strategy.

Just remember: no matter the format, a real estate agent plan only works if you actually use it. Your fancy leather planner doesn’t matter if it lives in your trunk.

Section 5: Comparing Real Estate Planners

Let’s get to the information you’ve been waiting for, the very best planners out there.

Trello for Real Estate Agents

Best for: Visual thinkers who prefer a drag-and-drop board layout

Features Agents Love:

  • Kanban-style boards with cards for listings, clients, or marketing campaigns
  • Checklists inside each card (perfect for deal stages)
  • Power-ups like calendar views and CRM syncing
  • The mobile app is smooth and easy to use on the go

How Agents Use It:

  • Use one board per pipeline (buyers, sellers, under contract)
  • Track lead status: Cold ? Warm ? Active ? Under Contract ? Closed
  • Organize real estate agent marketing plans with scheduled social posts and content links

Bonus:

Trello is fantastic for solo agents or those building out a real estate agent plan visually with flexibility and less setup than Asana.

2025 Real Estate Agent Planner Pro

Best for: Solo agents who want a sleek, fillable daily planning system without carrying a physical notebook

Features Agents Love:

  • Daily layout with time-blocking, lead tracking, and follow-up prompts
  • Sections for affirmations, gratitude, goals, and prospecting
  • Monthly and quarterly goal review pages
  • Instantly downloadable and fillable on any tablet or PDF app

How Agents Use It:

  • Use on an iPad or tablet as a fully digital real estate agent daily planner
  • Fill it out each morning with top 3 goals, client priorities, and content tasks
  • Review performance and adjust strategy weekly

Bonus:

If you like structure but want flexibility, this planner’s format is perfect for staying organized without needing sticky notes.

PhoneLife Daily Realtor Digital Planner

Best for: Agents who want a vintage-inspired aesthetic digital planner.

Features Agents Love:

  • Elegant, antique design with realtistic coils
  • Digital tabs for daily, weekly, and monthly views
  • Space for lead info, marketing plans, call logs, and transaction timelines
  • PDF format – designed for GoodNotes, Notability, or similar

How Agents Use It:

  • Navigate between sections instantly on your tablet
  • Organize multiple clients and listing stages in a beautiful layout
  • Keep everything from goal tracking to time blocking in one app

Bonus:

A planner with style and strategy – it looks like a keepsake but works like a machine.

Vertical Week + Month Planner

Best for: Agents who love time-blocking and want to see their week and month in one view

Features Agents Love:

  • Full weekly and monthly layout shown side-by-side
  • Vertical time blocks perfect for showing hours and appointments
  • Ample space for personal and professional notes
  • Premium-quality paper and stylish hard cover

How Agents Use It:

  • Set appointments in vertical time blocks for showings and closings
  • Write weekly prospecting goals alongside daily tasks
  • Keep both your personal and business calendars aligned

Bonus:

Perfect for agents who hate flipping pages and want to see everything now.

Gemma Weekly Weekly/Monthly Planning Calendar

Best for: New agents or budget-conscious pros who need a no-fuss, full-size planner

Features Agents Love:

  • 8.5×11 size gives you tons of space to write
  • Clean, modern layout with monthly and weekly pages
  • Monthly tab dividers and a durable cover
  • Affordable and easy to replace annually

How Agents Use It:

  • Track appointments, tasks, and follow-ups without digital distractions
  • Use as a transaction and listing timeline calendar
  • Jot down client notes, lead status, and to-do lists

Bonus:

It’s the entry-level best planner for real estate agents who want structure without the price tag.

ClickUp for Real Estate Agents

Best for: Agents and teams desiring a customizable, all-in-one productivity platform.

Features Agents Appreciate:

  • Customizable dashboards for tracking listings, leads, and marketing campaigns.
  • Task automation, reminders, and recurring tasks to manage follow-ups and deadlines.
  • Integration capabilities with calendars, CRMs, and communication tools.
  • Time tracking and goal-setting features to monitor productivity.

How Agents Utilize It:

  • Organize tasks by client, property, or transaction stage.
  • Set up templates for recurring processes like new listings or buyer onboarding.
  • Collaborate with team members by assigning tasks and sharing updates in real-time.

Bonus:

ClickUp’s versatility allows agents to tailor the platform to their specific needs, making it a flexible choice for various real estate operations.

Monday.com for Real Estate Teams

Best for: Teams seeking a visual and collaborative approach to project management.

Features Agents Appreciate:

  • Visual boards to track property statuses, client interactions, and marketing efforts.
  • Automated notifications and reminders to stay on top of tasks.
  • Integration with tools like Gmail, Outlook, and various CRMs.
  • Time tracking and reporting features to assess team performance.

How Agents Utilize It:

  • Manage the entire sales pipeline from lead generation to closing.
  • Coordinate open houses, showings, and client meetings.
  • Monitor marketing campaigns and their effectiveness.

Bonus:

Monday.com’s intuitive interface makes it easy for teams to adopt and customize workflows without extensive training.

Basecamp for Real Estate Collaboration

Best for: Teams and brokerages focusing on communication and task management.

Features Agents Appreciate:

  • Centralized communication channels to reduce email clutter.
  • To-do lists, schedules, and document sharing in one platform.
  • Client access to specific projects for transparency.
  • Automatic check-ins to keep the team aligned.

How Agents Utilize It:

  • Coordinate with clients, photographers, and contractors during the listing process.
  • Share documents like contracts and disclosures securely.
  • Plan marketing strategies and track their implementation.

Bonus:

Basecamp’s simplicity and focus on communication make it a favorite for teams aiming to enhance collaboration without overwhelming complexity.

Smartsheet for Real Estate Project Tracking

Best for: Agents and teams requiring spreadsheet-like interfaces with advanced functionalities.

Features Agents Appreciate:

  • Grid, card, Gantt chart, and calendar views for versatile project tracking.
  • Automation of repetitive tasks and reminders.
  • Integration with tools like Google Workspace, Microsoft Office, and various CRMs.
  • Robust reporting and analytics features.

How Agents Utilize It:

  • Track transaction timelines and ensure compliance with deadlines.
  • Manage budgets for marketing and property preparations.
  • Analyze performance metrics to inform business decisions.

Bonus:

Smartsheet combines the familiarity of spreadsheets with powerful project management features, catering to agents who prefer data-driven approaches.

Flowlu for Comprehensive Real Estate Management

Best for: Agents seeking an all-in-one solution encompassing CRM, project management, and financial tracking.

Features Agents Appreciate:

  • Integrated CRM to manage client relationships and communication.
  • Project management tools to oversee transactions and marketing campaigns.
  • Financial modules for invoicing, expense tracking, and budgeting.
  • Knowledge base and document management for easy access to resources.

How Agents Utilize It:

  • Maintain detailed client profiles and track interactions.
  • Oversee the progress of listings from initiation to closing.
  • Manage financial aspects of the business, ensuring profitability.

Bonus:

Flowlu’s comprehensive suite of tools reduces the need for multiple platforms, streamlining operations for real estate professionals.

Asana for Real Estate Agents

Best for: Teams and agents who want automation, clarity, and structured workflows

Features Agents Love:

  • Task templates for transactions, listings, open houses, and follow-ups
  • Timeline views for closings and escrow periods
  • Recurring tasks (great for weekly marketing or lead follow-ups)
  • Integrations with Gmail, Slack, Google Calendar, Zapier, and CRMs like Follow Up Boss

How Agents Use It:

  • Create a “project” for each listing with subtasks for staging, photography, MLS upload, etc.
  • Assign tasks to transaction coordinators or team members
  • Set due dates and automate reminders

Bonus:

Asana has a “My Tasks” view that acts like a dynamic real estate agent daily planner. Agents can drag and drop tasks to prioritize each day.

The Planner Is the Playbook: Stop Winging It, Start Winning It

A chaotic day doesn’t mean you’re productive – it just means you’re reacting. With the right real estate agent planner, your tasks turn into deals, and your time finally works for you. Find more important agent career moves in our Agent Success Hub.

And, if you’re looking for some awesome ongoing agent support, check out Smart Agent Alliance. When you partner with Smart Agent Alliance at eXp Realty, you get the combined firepower of sponsors Smart Agent Alliance and the Wolf Pack – two of the most supportive and production-focused sponsor teams at eXp.

Here’s what you get with us:

  • A branded agent attraction site that works 24/7
  • Automated email drip campaigns to keep your name top-of-mind
  • Webinars and 1-on-1 support to help your prospects convert
  • Our high-converting website – ranked #2 in organic traffic across all eXp sponsor teams
  • Elite Wolf Pack training, weekly masterminds, and Mike Sherrard’s Social Agent Academy Pro

We even throw in done-for-you marketing templates, customizable landing pages, fast onboarding, and a centralized agent portal that ties it all together.

Choose the team that’s already built the engine – you just drive.
Learn more at SmartAgentAlliance.com

Frequently Asked Questions

What are the most important real estate agent tasks to track in a planner?

You should track appointments, follow-ups, open houses, social content, transaction timelines, and leads across every stage.

What software do real estate agents use to manage tasks and time?

Agents use tools like Follow Up Boss, Boldtrail, Trello, and Asana – often integrated into their real estate agent planner for daily task and calendar management.

Is a digital or paper planner better for real estate agents?

Digital planners are best for on-the-go automation and syncing. Paper planners work well for agents who prefer writing things down. Use what you’ll stick with.

Why is a real estate agent planner important for teams?

It keeps everyone aligned on responsibilities, timelines, and updates – avoiding miscommunications and dropped leads.

How does a real estate agent planner help with time management?

Planners let you block time for high-priority tasks, set reminders, and keep your day structured – so nothing important gets forgotten.

title: How eXp Onboarding Works in 6 Steps - And How Not to Blow It
excerpt: Key Points Your sponsor choice locks in your entire upline - choose wisely. The Join eXp application has no do-overs - list your sponsor carefully.…
content:
Key Points

  • Your sponsor choice locks in your entire upline – choose wisely.
  • The Join eXp application has no do-overs – list your sponsor carefully.
  • License transfer usually takes 2 – 4 days after eXp approval.
  • Great sponsors offer training, tech, and revenue share support.
  • Co-sponsors can’t provide team value, only individual support.
  • eXp onboarding spans 8 days, 1 – 5 hours of tasks per day.
  • Smart Agent Alliance helps simplify onboarding with 1-on-1 guidance.

Getting your real estate license was the hard part… said no one ever who’s been through onboarding alone at 2 a.m. with six tabs open, a sad snack, and zero clue what an ICA is (learn more about the Independent Contractor Agreement at eXp).

If you’re joining eXp Realty and wondering what fresh hell you’re walking into – or better yet, how to actually get set up for success – breathe. It’s not that bad… unless you don’t pick the right sponsor. (FYI: most eXp sponsors don’t offer anything besides a prayer.)

The eXp onboarding process is built for agents who are ready to hit the ground running at a top-tier virtual real estate brokerage. But like most things in real estate, how you start matters.

What to Expect with eXp Realty Onboarding
Step 1: Pick a Sponsor (Carefully. Seriously.)
Step 2: Fill Out the Join eXp Application
Step 3: Wait for Active Status
Step 4: Receive Sponsor Value
Step 5: Optional Co-Sponsor
Step 6: eXp’s Onboarding Day 1 to Day 8 Tasks

Day 1: Welcome, Setup, and Must-Do Tasks
Day 2: Explore, Set Up Marketing Basics
Day 3: Skip and Chill
Day 4: Tools, Offices, and Extras
Day 5: Optional Revenue Tools (and Warnings)
Day 6: Skim & Save for Later
Day 7: Website, Branding, and Social
Day 8: Survey & Send-Off
Ready to Make Your Onboarding Count?

Smart Agent Alliance: The Sponsor Team That Works for Your Revenue Share
The Wolf Pack: Elite Training, Culture, and Collaboration
Even More with Smart Agent Alliance…
Frequently Asked Questions

What to Expect with eXp Realty Onboarding

eXp onboarding is built like a factory line – but in a good way. Fast, clean, and surprisingly functional. It’s designed to help eXp agents get fully equipped with the tools, training, and support needed to start buying and selling homes fast (translation: get paid sooner).

But if you walk in blind without knowing how it works? You could be in for a world of confusion – and maybe even regret.

So let’s break it down. Here’s a recap of the 6 key eXp Realty onboarding steps we’ll cover in detail below:

  1. Pick a Sponsor
  2. Fill out the Join eXp Application
  3. Wait for Active Status
  4. Receive Sponsor Value
  5. Optional Co-Sponsor
  6. eXp’s Official 8 Day Onboarding Kicks Off

Step 1: Pick a Sponsor (Carefully. Seriously.)

If we sound like a broken record here, good. Because picking your eXp sponsor is the most important decision you’ll make outside of “should I become a real estate agent in the first place?”

Here’s why: most eXp Realty agents never realize how much sponsor support varies until it’s too late – and then they have agent sponsor regrets. Most eXp sponsors offer nothing. Others, like Smart Agent Alliance, offer an entire ecosystem of tools, mentorship, training, marketing help, and production support. We’re talking real support – not “give me a call if you need something.”

Pro tip: This sponsor choice includes the sponsor you name and their full upline of 6 more agents.  So, don’t blow this. Choose a sponsor who’s part of a strong upline team. Lone-wolf agents can’t give you the kind of leverage that team sponsors with layers of support (like us) can. It’s the difference between plugging into a system… or being left Googling “how to get started as a real estate agent” at 1 a.m.

Quick heads-up on common confusion:
Your eXp sponsor is not the same as a production team leader or mentor. Some agents make this confusing on purpose (shocker), especially if they’ve built a fancy site around their local production team.

Here’s the breakdown:

  • Sponsor teams – You must name them when you apply to eXp. They offer various levels of agent support (ranging from “literally nothing” to “why didn’t I join this sooner?”). They cost you $0.
  • Production teams – You join them anytime after you’re an active eXp agent. They’re great for day-to-day transaction help – but they take 25%+ of your commission.

Step 2: Fill Out the Join eXp Application

Once you’ve picked your sponsor (hi, hopefully us), you’ll go to the Join eXp application. Here’s what happens next:

  1. First, if you have any trouble with your application, reach out to eXpert Care at 833-303-0610 or contact your sponsor.
  2. Access the official Join Us platform through eXp’s website.
  3. Fill it out completely. Double-check that your name matches your real estate license exactly.
  4. Name your sponsor (don’t skip this – if you leave it blank, you don’t get a do-over.)
  5. Set up direct deposit and upload your W-9
  6. Read and sign your Independent Contractor Agreement (ICA) – this defines your business relationship with eXp Realty. Not exactly beach reading, but it matters.
  7. Submit – your application is reviewed by eXp Onboarding (usually within 24 hours)

Step 3: Wait for Active Status

Once your app is approved by eXp Onboarding, it gets passed to your state broker, who pulls your license from your old brokerage or your state department of real estate if you’re brand new.

That process usually takes 48 – 72 hours, depending on your state.

In the meantime, don’t just refresh your inbox 37 times a day. Instead:

  • Ask your sponsor for an eXp World pass – take a tour, click around
  • Get your professional photos done – you’ll need them for your marketing
  • Haven’t heard anything from eXp in 4 days? Call eXpert Care (833-303-0610) and ask to speak to onboarding.

Step 4: Receive Sponsor Value

Congrats – you’re now an active eXp Realty agent. This is where it gets real.
If you chose a sponsor who actually delivers (like Smart Agent Alliance), this is when the good stuff kicks in – and it’s all free:

  1. Private 1-on-1 onboarding call
  2. Production help with top courses and live tips
  3. Revenue share support for passive income
  4. Community, connection, motivation, inspiration
  5. Access to training, tools, and templates

But if your sponsor ghosted you… or you didn’t realize that naming a sponsor on your application locked in your access to a full upline team and not just one person, yeah – it stings.

The good news? You’re not completely out of luck. You still have one more card to play: the co-sponsor.

Step 5: Optional Co-Sponsor

You’ve got 5 days from the date you become active to name a co-sponsor if you’d like one.

This is a second layer of support – totally optional, but potentially helpful if you want to add a local connection or specific skillset to your corner. Think of it as filling in the gaps your primary sponsor team doesn’t meet.

Keep in mind: a co-sponsor can only offer individual support – not the full upline structure that comes with the primary sponsor you named on your eXp application. But if you choose wisely, the right co-sponsor can still bring meaningful value, mentorship, and strategic help to your business.

Need help finding one? Use the eXp directory to search by location and find someone whose vibe actually fits. Then call them. Ask what they’re willing to offer you – for free. Because handing over part of your revenue to someone who’s not lifting a finger? That’s how you build regret, not a career.

Step 6: eXp’s Onboarding Day 1 to Day 8 Tasks

Now that you’re officially in, it’s time to tackle the actual eXp onboarding process – the part where you stop asking “Where do I click?” and start saying, “Let’s close something.”

This is where the eXp Realty/Residential Quick Start Guide comes in. It’s a clear, step-by-step plan broken into eight manageable days of onboarding. Time commitment? Usually 1–5 hours per day. So, not a hostage situation – but still, put coffee on.

Here’s what you can expect from the onboarding process:

  • A clearly structured task list that builds on itself
  • eXpert Care concierge backup for things you just don’t get
  • And if you picked the right sponsor (ahem, Smart Agent Alliance), we’ll provide tips for effectively onboarding too, privately 1-on-1.

Ok, here’s what the official eXp onboarding really involves – minus the fluff and plus the hacks that make it faster.

Day 1: Welcome, Setup, and Must-Do Tasks

On Day 1, you can expect to:

  • Get to Know the Mentor Program (if applicable) – If you’re assigned one, you’ll circle back to this later. Pro tip: You can change your mentor if they’re not helpful.
  • Attend the Live Agent Startup Session – This will walk you through much of Day 1, so reserve your session first and make that your Day 1.
  • Join Your Local Realtor Association, State Association, and MLS – This isn’t optional. It’s the cost of being a “Realtor” and a local member with the ability to do an agent’s job. 
  • Attend Your State Broker Orientation – Meet your broker, learn the ropes.

You’ll also knock out some quick tech setup on Day 1. Start by finding your eXp email alias through OKTA – this acts as your “passport” to all things eXp. Then log in to Workplace and Workplace Chat (just poke around – you don’t need to master it today), as well as My eXp and Enterprise, two key platforms you’ll get familiar with over time. You’ll also want to opt in to kvCORE (now called BoldTrail) to trigger the creation of your agent website – just note it takes about 7–10 days to go live. And spend a few minutes learning about SkySlope, our transaction management platform, but save the training for when you have a transaction.

Day 2: Explore, Set Up Marketing Basics

On Day 2, it’s time to:

  • Set Up Your Voicemail – Yes, people still leave voicemails.
  • Tour eXp World – If you can squeeze in the 30-minute tour today, do it.
  • Decide on Your Business Phone – Use your cell, Google Voice, or pay monthly for Twilio. (We use our cells.)
  • Order Marketing Materials – The free starter kit is from BuildASign, but what’s included changes. If you want to use a custom design, no problem.  Just get broker approval.
  • Explore Exclusive eXp Canva Marketing Templates
  • Set Up Your Email Alias & Signature – Only needed if you want to reply from your @exprealty.com email via Gmail or Yahoo.

Day 3: Skip and Chill

Day 3 is basically your breather day. eXp’s task list includes checking out the eXp Training Calendar and poking around eXp University – but honestly, if you’re with a strong training team like Smart Agent Alliance, you’ll probably get more value from our live coaching and production systems than sifting through generic modules. Translation: don’t waste hours here on Day 3.

This is also the day when new agents (fewer than 3 closed deals in the last 12 months) get introduced to the Mentor Program. If that’s you, block out a full hour to understand how it works and what to expect moving forward – it’s worth the time. But never forget – you can change your mentor if you don’t vibe with the assigned eXp Certified Mentor.

Day 4: Tools, Offices, and Extras

Here’s what you can expect for Day 4, you’ll visit:

  • DISC Assessment via Success Coaching – 10 minutes of personality quiz fun. Optional.
  • Clearwater Agent Healthcare – Only if you need it.
  • Regus Office Access – Free shared office lounges if you want a professional space to work or meet clients.
  • SISU – Analytics and tracking tool. Note it for later.
  • eXp DialSafe – Only relevant if you’re cold calling.

Day 5: Optional Revenue Tools (and Warnings)

Ok, Day 5 includes a lot of information that new agents don’t need right away.  So, skip most of this section unless you’re ready to explore:

  • Zenlist – Off-market listings and an upgraded MLS-style interface.
  • Revenos – eXp-provided leads (eXp Relocation, Affinity, Military, BundleSelect, REO, Institutional Investment Services) but you’ll pay 25%–55% when deals close. Get certified to access. Pro tip: Certify faster at eXpCON – 3 hours vs. 12.
  • Express Offers – Great for new agents. Learn how to submit investor offers quickly.
  • Making It Rain – made for you Facebook Ads, explore when ready.

Day 6: Skim & Save for Later

Day 6 is another light day – think of it as a choose-your-own-adventure, but without the pressure to actually choose anything yet. This is your chance to scroll through some of the optional tools and programs eXp offers. Just read the explanations, get a feel for what’s available, and file them away in your brain (or bookmarks) for when the time is right.

You’ll come across things like eXp Solutions, the paid Lofty CRM (for those who don’t vibe with BoldTrail), and extras like eXp Stock Programs, Success Lending, Flowcode, and even the Luxury Certification. It’s all good stuff – but none of it needs action today. Skim now, explore later.

Day 7: Website, Branding, and Social

Today’s all about polishing your online presence – but only if the timing makes sense. If your BoldTrail site (formerly kvCORE) is live, now’s the time to jump in and start customizing it. If not, no stress – just make a note to come back when it is.

You’ll also see a prompt to start promoting yourself on social media. If that’s already your thing, go for it. If not? Hold off and check out our free training instead – it’s designed for agents who don’t want to learn the hard way.

You’ll also get nudged to “expand your network” and “review eXp docs,” but honestly, those are just friendly suggestions. If you’re in the mood to connect, great. If not, save it for another day. There’s no prize for reading every document twice.

Day 8: Survey & Send-Off

You made it to the final day – nicely done. The only task on your plate is the NPS survey. It goes directly to eXp (not us), but yes, they really do care about your feedback. So be honest, but maybe don’t unload about your cousin’s expired license drama.

Once that’s done? You’re officially onboarded. Welcome to eXp Realty. Time to shift from setup mode to success mode – and don’t worry, we’ll be right here to help you make it count.

Ready to Make Your Onboarding Count?

The eXp onboarding process is fast, structured, and – if you know what to expect – not nearly as overwhelming as it looks from the outside. Whether you’re just figuring out how to get started as a real estate agent or you’re a seasoned pro switching to a virtual real estate brokerage, one thing holds true: your first few days set the tone for everything else.

From sponsor selection to tech setup to navigating the official onboarding process, it’s easy to miss crucial support if you don’t know what you’re doing – or who you’re working with. Together, we’ve got you covered on everything agents actually care about: community, production support, and passive income growth through revenue share.

Smart Agent Alliance: The Sponsor Team That Works for Your Revenue Share

Let’s be honest – most agents don’t join eXp thinking about revenue share. But ask a long-time eXp agent their #1 regret? Not building it sooner. At Smart Agent Alliance, we actually invest time and money into helping you grow passive income through the revenue share model. Here’s what you get:

The Wolf Pack: Elite Training, Culture, and Collaboration

Frequently Asked Questions

How does eXp Realty onboarding work?

eXp Realty onboarding starts after you apply and name your sponsor. Once approved and your license is transferred, you’ll follow an 8-day Quick Start Guide that walks you through tools, training, and systems.

Before onboarding, you need to pick a sponsor, complete the Join eXp application, and be ready to pay your $85 monthly and $64 first-month admin fee. New agents also must pay their Realtor association and MLS fees to those entities (not to eXp).

How long does it take to become active at eXp Realty?

After submitting your application, most agents are active within 1–4 days, depending on how quickly your state broker transfers your license.

What is the mentor program at eXp Realty?

Agents with fewer than 3 closed deals in the past 12 months are automatically assigned an eXp Certified Mentor. The split is 60/40 for your first 3 deals, then you go to the normal 80/20 split. You can switch mentors if the assigned one isn’t a fit.

title: Realtor Domain Strategy: Standout Domain Names for Real Estate Agents
excerpt: Key Points Your domain is your first impression and online handshake. Catchy real estate domain names boost trust and memorability. Keep domains short, brandable, and…
content:
Key Points

  • Your domain is your first impression and online handshake.
  • Catchy real estate domain names boost trust and memorability.
  • Keep domains short, brandable, and SEO-friendly.
  • Add local terms for better search rankings and niche targeting.
  • Match your domain to your vibe, niche, and client style.
  • Check social handles before locking in a domain name.
  • .Realtor domains build trust with clients and avoid spammy vibes.
  • Avoid long, awkward, or typo-prone domain names.

If your realtor domain name sounds like it came free with a dial-up CD, we’ve got a problem. In today’s real estate game, your domain isn’t just an address – it’s your first impression, your handshake, and your shot at being remembered by someone who clicked five other agents before you. A catchy real estate domain name isn’t a nice-to-have – it’s the bare minimum for getting found, building trust, and showing you’re not stuck in 2007.

Whether you’re a solo real estate agent, forming a team, or launching that bold real estate brand you’ve been dreaming about, your real estate domain name has to slap fast, clear, and unforgettable.

This guide’s here to help you pick the best realtor domain name possible. We’ll break down what works, what flops, and how to craft a domain that holds up to search engines, branding goals, and your long game in a very crowded space.

1. What Are Real Estate Domain Names?
2. Why Domain Names Matter for Realtors
3. How to Choose the Best Real Estate Domain Name

4. Common Mistakes to Avoid (Unless You Like Getting Lost Online)

5. Branding-Driven Domains That Actually Stick (Like a Great Commission Check)

Why Choose a .realtor Domain Name? (A.K.A. Your Built-In Trust Badge)

Why Your Realtor Domain Name Deserves More Than a Second Thought

Smart Agent Alliance: The Sponsor Team That Works for Your Revenue Share
The Wolf Pack: Elite Training, Culture, and Collaboration
Frequently Asked Questions

1. What Are Real Estate Domain Names?

Your domain is your brand’s digital curb appeal, and selecting the right one can significantly impact your online visibility. It’s not just a link – it’s your online “hello,” your instant credibility meter, and the thing people type in after hearing your name in a Facebook group or on a yard sign.

In the cutthroat world of real estate agents and realtors, the right realtor website name gives you a head start before anyone even clicks your site. It helps define your niche (looking at you, SunnyvaleLuxuryHomes.com), builds your authority, and keeps you top of mind with clients who are bombarded by forgettable agent sites daily.

Whether you’re going big with real estate team names or locking in your personal real estate brand, this is where the rubber meets the URL. And with so many options now – .com, .realtor, .realty – the pressure’s on to pick a domain that actually says something. The best real estate domain names don’t just check the box – they make a statement.

2. Why Domain Names Matter for Realtors

You could be the best closer in town with a dream listing pipeline and a killer follow-up game – but if clients can’t find you online? It’s game over.

A strong domain name for real estate agents builds instant credibility, enhancing trust with potential clients.”. It tells people, “Hey, I’m legit,” not “I paid $12 for this template and called it a day.” The best realtor domain names are short, memorable, brandable, and SEO-friendly. Think less alphabet soup, more brand power.

With nearly 90% of buyers starting their home search online, your domain name is one of your most valuable marketing assets – right next to your license and your coffee IV. Smart agents are securing domains that match their market, brand, or even niche real estate group names, because it makes a difference in search rankings, trust, and referrals.

So yeah – your real estate domain name matters. Big time. Want to stand out in a sea of sameness? Start with the right domain. Then build your empire on top of it.

3. How to Choose the Best Real Estate Domain Name

Before your dream client ever hears your voice, your real estate domain name is doing the talking. Whether you’re a solo realtor building your name, launching a site for your real estate team, or expanding your digital empire, your domain sets the tone for everything that follows. Pick a winner, and the internet plays nice. Pick a dud, and well…welcome to Page 7 of Google.

Let’s break down how to choose a realtor domain name that actually does some work – online and off.

Make It Memorable and Catchy

If your domain name sounds like a password reset link, throw it out. The best real estate domain names are sticky – in a good way. Think rhyme, rhythm, or just something bold. Names like CoastalKeyHomes.com or BrickAndBloom.com have a nice ring to them. On the flip side, YourNameRealEstate123.net is a cry for help.

If you’re going the team route, great! Real estate team names and real estate agent team names that double as your domain are branding gold – consistency across your signs, social, and site is how you win the long game.

Keep It Short. Keep It Simple.

Say it with me: no dashes, no numbers, no ten-word sentences pretending to be domains. You want something clean and typeable – especially if you’re saying it out loud in videos, at networking events, or on your open house signs.

Realty domain names like TheLoftGroup.com or PineAndCoRealty.com? Chef’s kiss.
RealEstateForYouAndYourFamilyAndAlsoYourDog.com? Not so much.

Add a Local Flavor

Location, location, location – it’s not just for listings. The best real estate domain names for agents often include your geographic focus to boost local SEO and help clients find you faster.

Need inspiration?
ScottsdaleLuxuryHomes.com
BayAreaPropertyPro.com

You’re not just building a brand – you’re planting your flag.

Match Your Brand Vibe

Are you serving luxe oceanfront estates or flipping rentals in up-and-coming burbs? Your domain should match that energy. Use creative realtor names ideas that reflect your niche, style, and ideal client. Make sure it actually sounds like something you would say – and that your target client would click on.

Ask yourself: Would I trust this site if I saw it in a Facebook group comment?

Check Social Media Handles (Seriously)

Your realtor website name isn’t living in a vacuum. It’s part of your whole online identity. Before you commit, make sure you can get the matching username on Instagram, YouTube, Facebook, TikTok, LinkedIn, and whatever the algorithm gods throw at us next.

Consistency builds credibility. It also makes you easier to find when someone says, “Hey, I think I saw their ad on Instagram.”

Lock Down the Variations

Once you’ve scored a solid real estate domain, don’t get lazy. Buy the common misspellings. Grab your name with and without the “the.” Snag both .com and .realtor if you can.

Especially if you’re building real estate group names, those backup domains can save your bacon down the road – like when you become big enough to attract copycats.

4. Common Mistakes to Avoid (Unless You Like Getting Lost Online)

Even the most genius real estate domain name ideas can tank if you miss the basics. Think of your domain like curb appeal: it doesn’t matter how amazing the inside is if people get scared off by the weeds out front. Your realtor domain name is often the first thing a potential client sees – so don’t fumble it with rookie mistakes.

Here’s a hit list of what not to do when choosing your next online identity.

Mistake #1: Funky Spellings That Nobody Can Spell

Sure, ReelEstatePros.com might look cute in a pitch deck, but if clients can’t spell it, they can’t find it. You’re not building a puzzle – you’re building a brand.

Skip the weird spellings, silent letters, or “clever” puns that only make sense to you and your college roommate. You want realty domain names that are phonetically obvious and typo-proof.

SunnyRealty.com? Yes.
SunnEReeltee.biz? Stop it.

Mistake #2: Stuffing Keywords Like It’s Thanksgiving

We get it. You want that SEO juice. But domains like BestHomesForSaleInTampaFloridaRealEstateAgent.com sound more like a bot meltdown than a trusted brand.

Cramming five keywords into your realtor website name doesn’t scream “savvy marketer” – it screams “trying too hard.”

Keep it simple: TampaHomePro.com, BayViewRealty.com – clean, strong, and still SEO-friendly. Let your site’s content do the heavy SEO lifting.

Mistake #3: Choosing a Sketchy Extension

Yes, .com is still king. But .realtor or .homes? Totally fine if they fit your vibe and show off your NAR credentials. On the other hand, if your email ends in .info, .site, or something that looks like a phishing attempt from 2006… yeah, clients might bounce faster than your site speed.

YourName.realestate = Could work.
YourName.biz4u.info = That’s a virus, not a brand.

Mistake #4: Not Locking Down Related Domains

Let’s say you buy EliteHomeGroup.com and start building your brand. But then someone else grabs EliteHomesGroup.com and scoops up your leads. Yikes.

If you’re betting on your real estate team name to grow, play defense. Snag the typos, the plurals, the common mix-ups. Even better? Buy versions with both .com and .realtor to cover your bases.

Your future self (and your marketing budget) will thank you.

5. Branding-Driven Domains That Actually Stick (Like a Great Commission Check)

If you’re building a brand and not just tossing up a template site, your real estate domain name needs to sound like it belongs on a billboard, not a Craigslist ad. The best realtor domain names are short, catchy, clean – and flexible enough to grow with you, from solo show to team empire.

Here are six branding-first real estate domain names that stick the landing:

  • UrbanNestings.com – Modern, memorable, and sounds like you know your way around a skyline.
  • HomeHarmony.com – Warm and fuzzy, perfect for lifestyle-focused agents who sell more than square footage.
  • TheLoftGroup.com – Sleek, team-ready, and upscale enough to attract buyers who want hardwood over carpet.
  • CozyCottageListings.com – Ultra-niche, super search-friendly, and full of HGTV energy.
  • BrickAndBloom.com – Creative, brandable, and just vague enough to grow with your business.
  • HearthAndHomeRealty.com – Timeless and trustworthy with that sweet emotional pull buyers love.

Pro tip: These double as strong real estate team names – so when you’re no longer flying solo, your brand doesn’t need a full-blown identity crisis.

Geo + Niche = SEO Gold (A.K.A. Lead Magnet Mode)

If you want your real estate domain name to do the dirty work of SEO while sounding legit, go for the formula: location + specialty. It’s the domain name version of showing up with comps and charisma.

Here are six real estate domain name suggestions that bring the clicks:

  • ScottsdaleLuxuryHomes.com – Sounds like money. Also ranks like a boss.
  • BayAreaPropertyPro.com – Clean, confident, and keyword-rich.
  • DenverLoftExperts.com – Specific, local, and nichey in the best way.
  • TampaInvestmentHomes.com – Investors will flock. So will Google.
  • NashvilleNewBuilds.com – Hello, new construction buyers.
  • AustinEcoHomes.com – Trendy, topical, and smart for green-minded clients.

If your realtor domain name tells people what you do and where you do it, you’re halfway to lead gen heaven.

Why Choose a .realtor Domain Name? (A.K.A. Your Built-In Trust Badge)

Most agents still default to .com like it’s a reflex – until they realize every decent domain has already been scooped up by someone’s cousin’s side hustle. Enter: .realtor. It’s not just a backup plan; it’s your credibility upgrade.

What Makes .realtor Different?

Exclusivity. Only members of the National Association of Realtors® can use it. That means a realtor domain name doesn’t just look legit – it proves you are. In a world where everyone knows a “real estate expert,” this domain signals you’re actually certified to help, not just post house pics for likes.

Take a look at how clean this branding can be:

  • SmithGroup.realtor
  • UrbanNest.realtor
  • NextChapterHomes.realtor

These names sound sharp, professional, and – best of all – aren’t buried under spammy vibes. Plus, Google treats .realtor like any other top-level domain, so your SEO stays intact. No penalties. No tradeoffs.

Why Agents and Teams Should Lock It In

Trying to find real estate domain names that aren’t 37 characters long? .realtor gives you a better shot. It works for:

  • Teams who want consistent, clean branding
  • Solo agents who need to stand out instantly
  • Anyone sick of seeing “this domain is already taken”

It also adds a layer of scam protection. Clients know they’re landing on a verified agent’s site – not some lead gen trap with outdated fonts and broken promises.

If your brand is playing for keeps, securing a realtor domain name with .realtor is your quiet power move. Because the only thing worse than a bad domain name… is losing a good one to someone who just started yesterday.

Why Your Realtor Domain Name Deserves More Than a Second Thought

Your domain isn’t just a link – it’s your brand’s digital handshake, and in a sea of agent websites, yours needs to actually say something. A great realtor domain name builds trust, earns clicks, and sets the tone for everything else. For more ideas on the domain topic check out godaddy’s domain advice and domain advice from web4realty.com.  And, be sure to check out other real estate agent marketing ideas in our Agent Success Hub.

When you join Smart Agent Alliance, you’re not just getting domain advice – you’re getting the FREE value stack of two teams – Smart Agent Alliance + the Wolf Pack.

Smart Agent Alliance: The Sponsor Team That Works for Your Revenue Share

Most agents don’t join eXp for the revenue share passive income – but once they see the potential, they wish they had our resources and support. We help you build passive income with proven tools, webinars, 1-on-1 help, and a top-performing website. Who else puts their time, money, and energy into making you a passive income? Plus, Smart Agent Alliance does a whole lot more to up your production with everything from customizable landing pages to personalized onboarding to get launched fast!

The Wolf Pack: Elite Training, Culture, and Collaboration

You’ll gain access to the #1 agent community, weekly coaching, exclusive masterminds, and Mike Sherrard’s Social Agent Academy Pro (others pay $997/year for access) and more…all for free to our sponsee agents.

You could roll the dice with a random sponsor – or pick one who built the machine for your success.

Explore how Smart Agent Alliance can help you grow faster and earn smarter at SmartAgentAlliance.com.
Not sure if eXp is right for you? Take the quiz. Want to see your revenue share potential? Use the calculator.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is a realtor domain name?

A realtor domain name is your real estate website address. It’s how clients find you online and builds instant brand credibility.

Why do real estate domain names matter?

Real estate domain names matter because they help clients trust you, find you online, and remember you – especially in a crowded market.

How do I choose the best realtor domain name?

Choose a name that’s short, catchy, easy to spell, and includes relevant keywords or location.

Should I use a .com or .realtor domain?

A .realtor domain is great if .com is taken. It adds trust and shows you’re a licensed agent.

What are common mistakes in choosing a real estate domain?

Avoid long names, weird spellings, keyword stuffing, sketchy extensions, or forgetting to secure domain variations.

title: Master Expired Listing Scripts: Turn Seller Rejection Into Income
excerpt: Key Points Expired listing scripts help turn rejection into real estate lead generation gold Personalizing your message beats copy-paste templates every time Confidence, empathy, and…
content:
Key Points

  • Expired listing scripts help turn rejection into real estate lead generation gold
  • Personalizing your message beats copy-paste templates every time
  • Confidence, empathy, and preparation convert leads into clients
  • A strong follow-up game separates closers from ghosters
  • Multiple communication channels = more responses, more listings
  • Objection handling starts with empathy, not pressure
  • The best expired listing letters show, not sell
  • Smart agents use storytelling to build trust fast
  • Your script isn’t a script – it’s a conversation starter
  • Expired listings = some of the best seller leads for realtors

Struggling with dead-end leads and ghosted follow-ups? Welcome to the wild world of real estate, where “no thanks” and “we’re just gonna wait” are practically background noise. But what if I told you those dreaded expired listings – the ones other agents gave up on – are secretly the best leads for real estate agents?

Yep. Behind every unsold property is a homeowner who’s either mad, confused, or halfway into a bottle of “maybe next year.” And guess what? That’s your in. With the right expired listing scripts, you’re not just another agent bothering them – you’re the one showing up with a plan.

They’re skeptical, disappointed, and totally over the process – which is exactly why you need to lead with empathy and come armed with something better than a cheesy flyer and a half-hearted pitch. Here’s your handy-dandy index:

Understanding Expired Listing Scripts

What Is an Expired Listing?
What Is an Expired Listing Script?
Importance of Scripts in Real Estate
Best Practices for Using Expired Listing Scripts

Top 10 Expired Listing Scripts

Expired listings aren’t dead – they’re just waiting for someone better.
Frequently Asked Questions

Understanding Expired Listing Scripts

What Is an Expired Listing?

Let’s break it down: an expired listing is a home that didn’t sell before the listing agreement ran out. The sign’s out of the yard, the listing’s off the MLS, and the seller is somewhere between annoyed and convinced real estate agents are the problem. Fun, right?

But here’s the thing – they still want to sell. They’re just exhausted, skeptical, and not looking to repeat a bad experience. That’s exactly why expired listing scripts are such a powerful tool. You’re not just showing up to pitch – you’re showing up to fix what went wrong. You’re not selling a house; you’re selling a better process.

What Is an Expired Listing Script?

Think of an expired listing script as a conversation starter – not a dramatic monologue. It’s designed to cut through the homeowner’s frustration and get them talking, not retreating. You’re not selling hope. You’re delivering solutions with a side of strategy.

The best expired listing scripts don’t follow a one-size-fits-all format. They adapt. Every seller has their own version of “what went wrong,” and your script needs to meet them where they are – whether that’s blaming the price, the pictures, or their cousin who “helped” stage the house.

You can start with a real estate expired listing script from resources like The Close, but smart agents tweak it, especially when you’re dropping off an expired listing letter or sending that perfectly crafted expired listing text script to break the ice. (Pro tip: Make it about them, not you.)

Importance of Scripts in Real Estate

Would you ever walk into a listing presentation without prepping? Of course not. So why would you cold-call a homeowner whose trust has already been shattered, without a plan?

Expired listing scripts give real estate agents a proven way to approach these calls with confidence. And in real estate, confidence is currency. Having a lead generation strategy that includes tested scripts means you’re not winging it… and you’re way more likely to convert leads to clients.

A great script doesn’t just sound smooth – it guides the conversation, handles objections, and helps you recover from that awkward pause when the homeowner hits you with “we’re not relisting right now.” Been there.

Best Practices for Using Expired Listing Scripts

You can have the best expired listing script on the planet – but if it sounds like you’re reading it under duress, it’s not doing you any favors. The goal? Sounds like a real person. A helpful, confident, empathetic real estate agent, not a telemarketer who’s two seconds from hanging up on themselves.

Practice your script until it feels natural, then ditch the robotic delivery. You’re not hosting a podcast; you’re having a conversation. When you know your talking points cold, you can pivot and respond based on what the homeowner actually says – that flexibility builds trust faster than a polished pitch ever could.

And remember: your expired listing script is not carved in stone. It’s a living, breathing thing. Keep refining it based on real conversations and objections you run into. The agents who treat scripts like tools, not gospel, are the ones consistently turning real estate leads into listings.

Research Before Reaching Out

Want to stand out? Show up with receipts.

Before firing off a call or dropping an expired listing letter, know the property’s backstory. How long was it listed? How many price drops? Did the photos look like they were taken on a flip phone?

Understanding what went wrong with the last listing – and being familiar with local market conditions – lets you personalize your approach and position yourself as the smarter choice. This level of prep turns cold calls into real estate lead generation gold.

Bonus: if you can name-drop the last agent’s failed open house strategy without sounding smug, even better.

Personalize Everything – Seriously

A generic expired listing letter template might be a time-saver, but it’s also an instant pass to the trash pile. Sellers can sniff out a copy-paste job from a mile away.

Instead, tailor your message. Use the seller’s name. Reference their specific property. Mention something about the listing history or neighborhood. Whether it’s a letter, a text script, or a DM, make it feel like it was written just for them. That kind of effort separates you from the other 19 agents who blasted out the same tired “we have a buyer” pitch.

Want to convert leads to clients? Start by treating them like people, not targets.

Don’t Rely on One Channel

Calling isn’t dead – but it’s not your only move. Successful real estate lead generation involves mixing it up. Try a mix of:

  • Social media messages
  • Phone calls
  • Emails
  • Texts

Hitting multiple channels increases your chance of connecting – and makes it clear you’re putting in real effort, not just checking a box. And no, that doesn’t mean spamming them. It means being strategic, professional, and just persistent enough to stay top of mind.

Build Trust from the First Interaction

Whether you’re reaching out through a letter for realtors, a phone call, or a LinkedIn message, your tone sets the tone (see what we did there?).

Be real. Be human. Show them you know your stuff, but don’t act like you’re saving them. Confidence, not arrogance. Sellers don’t want hype – they want help.

Lead with Empathy, Not Ego

Here’s the truth: what’s important to the seller may not be obvious to you. They might be upset, embarrassed, or just plain done with agents. That’s where empathy wins.

Start conversations by acknowledging their frustration. Use an expired listing letter sample that doesn’t scream “ME ME ME” but instead says, “I see you. Let’s fix this.”

Try this:

“It’s frustrating when a home doesn’t sell, especially when you did everything you thought was right. I’m reaching out not to pressure you, but to share a new approach that might work better.”

That’s the kind of language that gets read. Or at the very least, doesn’t get deleted immediately.

Objections? Bring ‘Em On.

Every Realtor who’s called on expireds knows the classics:

  • “I’m not selling right now.”
  • “I already hired someone else.”
  • “I’m just going to wait it out.”

Great. That’s your cue.

Come prepared with responses that validate their concerns and offer clarity – not defensiveness. For ideas, Market Leader’s objection-handling scripts are a solid reference. Your script should have a few empathetic responses on standby (yes, we’re talking about the “Empathetic Approach” template).

Because the real win isn’t just handling objections – it’s proving that you’re the real estate professional who listens, adjusts, and actually gets what they need.

Top 10 Expired Listing Scripts

These are your go-to weapons for turning rejection into revenue. Whether you’re calling, texting, or knocking on doors like it’s Halloween for real estate agents, these scripts give you structure to get your message going.

1. Initial Contact Approach

Goal: Start a real conversation with someone who’s sick of hearing from agents.

Expired listing scripts start here. Your tone needs to be calm, confident, and not pushy. You’re not a vulture – you’re the professional who finally has a plan worth hearing. Lead with empathy, not ego.

Script Example:
“Hi, this is Morgan with eXp Realty. I noticed your home came off the market recently and just wanted to check in. What was your experience like the first time around?”

(Let them talk – then respond with something like:)
“Sounds frustrating, and honestly, you’re not alone. If you’d be open to it, I’d love to show you how other homeowners in similar situations got their homes sold after relisting. No pressure, just a conversation.”

2. Follow-Up Communication Techniques

Goal: Stay top of mind without becoming a nuisance.

Follow-up is where most real estate agents lose momentum. Your job is to gently remind the homeowner that you’re still around – and still offering value. Think thoughtful, not spammy.

Script Example (Text or Email):
“Hey Sarah, it’s Morgan again. Just wanted to share a quick article I wrote about pricing strategies that helped one of my sellers get multiple offers after relisting. Thought it might be helpful – happy to send if you’re curious!”

3. Appointment Setting Methods

Goal: Make it ridiculously easy for them to say “yes” to a meeting.

Don’t just ask “When works for you?” – come up with actual options. Bonus points if you offer virtual and in-person availability.

Script Example:
“Would it be helpful if we walked through what might’ve gone wrong and what can be done differently? I’m available Wednesday at 4 or Thursday at 11 – either work for you?”

4. Voicemail Message Strategies

Goal: Get them to call you back without sounding like a sales pitch.

Keep it short. Mention their address, say why you’re calling, and give them a reason to reply.

Script Example:
“Hey Mark, this is Morgan with eXp Realty. I saw your listing at 123 Oak Street came off the market. I’ve helped several nearby sellers in the same situation and thought you might like to hear how they got results. I’ll try you again, or feel free to text me – my number is 415-444-5555.”

5. Text Message Outreach

Goal: Start a fast, casual convo that feels human.

Texting is king for real estate leads. Keep it friendly, not formal – these real estate text message scripts from PropStream offer ideas. Think “neighbor,” not “marketer.”

Script Example:
“Hi Kelly! Quick note – your listing at 789 Elm expired recently. I’m a local agent with a fresh approach that’s worked well for similar homes. Mind if I share a few ideas?”

6. Email Communication Tactics

Goal: Stand out in a crowded inbox with relevance, clarity, and value.

Your expired listing letter for realtors needs a punchy subject line, personalization, and a crystal-clear benefit.

Subject Line: “Your Home Deserves a Better Second Chance”
Email Body:
Hi Mike, I noticed your home listing expired last week. I specialize in relaunch strategies that help sellers avoid a repeat experience. Want to see a quick 3-step plan that’s worked for my clients? Just reply and I’ll send it over.

7. Door-to-Door Interaction Script

Goal: Be memorable (in a good way).

You’re on their doorstep, so don’t lead with a hard sell. Be conversational, and leave behind a printed expired listing letter template or market update.

Script Example:
“Hi, I’m Morgan, a local Realtor. I noticed your home came off the market recently. Just wanted to introduce myself and drop off this quick market update. No pressure – I’m nearby if you ever want to chat about options moving forward.”

8. Market Analysis Presentation

Goal: Educate, don’t overwhelm.

Bring visuals. Show trends. Explain how their home fits into the current market – not just what happened before.

Script Sample (in person or Zoom):
“Here’s where the market was when you listed – and here’s what’s changed. If you priced at this range today, you’d likely be seeing X showings per week. Want to explore what relaunching could look like now?”

9. Price Discussion Approach

Goal: Show them you’re not afraid to have the tough conversations – gracefully.

Sellers often anchor to the old price. Your job? Help them pivot using data, not ego.

Script Example:
“I know pricing is personal, especially if you’ve already been through this once. But based on current comps and buyer activity, I’d recommend [strategy]. It’s not about going lower – it’s about going smarter.”

10. Client Success Story Sharing

Goal: Replace doubt with proof.

Use relatable stories from your real clients. Make it specific – location, timeline, what changed, and how it worked.

Script Example:
“I actually just helped a seller two blocks from you. Their listing expired last summer. We adjusted the price, changed the marketing, and it sold in 11 days. Would it help if I shared what we did differently?”

If those 10 ideas aren’t enough for you, check out these expired listing strategies by PropStream.

Expired listings aren’t dead – they’re just waiting for someone better.

And by “better,” we mean someone with a strategy, a brain, and a bit of charm (that’s you). Mastering expired listing scripts isn’t about memorizing lines – it’s about leading with empathy, staying consistent, and showing sellers that you’re not here to waste their time. You’re here to finally get their home sold. And when you’ve got that listing, be sure to run an awesome open house…you’ll need open-house sign-in sheets too.

Be sure to check out more awesome marketing ideas or other value from our Agent Success Hub.

Now imagine doing all this with backup:

Together, we deliver what agents want: a method to skyrocket production, a supportive & motivating community, and the systems to build serious passive revenue share income. And yes, while most agents join eXp for production, the #1 regret is not having systems for passive revenue share income. Choose the wrong eXp sponsor and you miss that opportunity. Smart Agent Alliance invests their time and money for you to gain passive income with eXp’s revenue share program. How awesome is that? It’s like free money.

The benefits of eXp Realty are unmatched and will truly exceed your expectations! Learn how Smart Agent Alliance can help you grow faster, earn smarter, and build a business with lasting impact.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is an expired listing in real estate?

An expired listing is a property that didn’t sell during its listing period and is no longer active on the MLS.

What are expired listing scripts?

Expired listing scripts are pre-written conversations that help real estate agents connect with homeowners whose listings didn’t sell.

Why are expired listings good leads for real estate agents?

How can I personalize my expired listing outreach?
